alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 08 at 10:50PM AKST until January 10 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Haines, Haines Highways, and Yakutat. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and cause power outages. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero near White Pass could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Ponding could develop after a changeover to rain on Monday, perhaps late Sunday night in Yakutat. In areas of deep snow pack, additional snow and a changeover to rain could challenge load bearing ability of roof-tops, boats, and aircraft. Confidence in a rain changeover is lowest in this region. There is a chance snow could mix with freezing rain at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
